rows.name: Development Experience and Knowledge
cells: Good sense to understand and analyze business processes, requirements, and formulate them in a written form. At least 1 year of relevant experience desirable but not essential.
At least 3 year of relevant experience.
At least 5 years of relevant experience, including UML, Modeling and Design skills
At least 7 years of relevant experience, including UML, Modeling and Design skills, expert knowledge of at least one business area, ability to coach and train others
At least 8 years of relevant experience, including UML, Modeling and Design skills, expert knowledge of at least one business area, ability to coach and train others

rows.name: Software Process Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have knowledge or experience of the software development processes
Expected to be able to follow a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow and understand a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow, understand, and enhance a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow, understand, actively influence and enhance a defined software development process

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Reads and understands project documentation, creates analysis and requirement documentation with supervision
Reads and understands project documentation, creates analysis and requirement documentation
Reads and understands project documentation, creates high-quality analysis and requirement documentation
Reads and understands project documentation, creates high-quality analysis, requirement and audit documentation
Reads and understands project documentation, creates high-quality analysis, requirement and audit documentation

rows.name: Business Domain Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have business domain knowledge or experience working with specific business areas
Has basic understanding of one business domain area. Expected to demonstrate ability to learn and systematize business knowledge
Has good knowledge and understanding of one business domain area. Proven abilities to quickly learn, systematize, and retain business knowledge.

Has expert knowledge and understanding of one business domain area. Has had exposure into other business areas and confirmed abilities to quickly learn, systematize, retain, and re-apply business knowledge. Can teach and tutor business concepts to project teams and colleagues.

Has expert knowledge in either a wide business knowledge area or multiple smaller areas.Â  Can teach and tutor business concepts to project teams and colleagues, can prepare training materials for a wider audience. On a par with industry SMEs in the area of business specialization. Demonstrates continuous self-education in the area of business specialization

rows.name: Job Title
cells: Junior Business Analyst
Business Analyst
Senior Business Analyst
Lead Business Analyst
Chief Business Analyst

rows.name: Roles Played on a Project
cells: Plays the Business/System Analyst role
Plays the Business/System Analyst role
Plays the role of a Key Business/System Analyst or a Team Lead of 2-5 Analysts
Plays the Key Business/System Analyst role, and usually also performs a Team Lead, Reviewer or Auditor role
Can play any Business/System Analyst role, typically a senior position. Responsibilities can include Team Lead, Reviewer, Auditor and Technical Trainer

rows.name: Reliability
cells: Expected to work effectively under supervision
Expected to work without direct supervision
Expected to be self-managing, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly

Expected to be self-managing, take full responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly. Expected to have proven experience in evaluating theoretical knowledge and practical (on-the-job) skills and the seniority level of candidates and providing actionable feedback and recommendations on positions/projects matching.

Expected to be self-managing, take full responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly. Expected to have proven experience in evaluating theoretical knowledge and practical (on-the-job) skills and the seniority level of candidates and providing actionable feedback and recommendations on positions/projects matching.

rows.name: Quality
cells: No specific expectations regarding quality
Must show a sense of responsibility for the quality of the deliverables created by him/her
Creates deliverables in good quality
Must be a role model for colleagues; creates deliverables in high quality
Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates deliverables in excellent-quality.

rows.name: Customer Relations
cells: Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; visit customers with supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision
Expected to participate in phone conference; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

Expected to be on a par with the best industry experts in customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

Expected to be on a par with the best industry experts in customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

rows.name: Language Level in the Customer's Communication Language
cells: Able to read and write the Customer's Communication Language and have advanced speaking ability
Able to read and write the Customer's Communication Language and have advanced speaking ability
Comfortably able to read and write and speak Customer's Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer's Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer's Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
